lines.text: the princess must marry the monkey.
And even though Uncle Monkey can't speak, he is still a great comfort to us both though, isn't he?
Mom, you're right. A lot of times Uncle Monkey has covered me in a blanket.
Princess, am I the father of this boy, or is the monkey?
That isn't fruit juice, son. That's wine. Drink that and you'll get drunk.
Wine? Really? And what if my monkeys drink it?

[to the drunken monkeys]
Remember the next time that when you see, hear and speak no evil, you also keep clear of the wine.
